info.name: Spinal nerve roots
info.description: Spinal nerve roots include the dorsal and ventral roots which join with one another to form the spinal nerves. The dorsal roots are afferent or sensory nerve fibers carrying information to the spinal cord while the ventral roots are efferent or motor nerve fibers carrying information from the spinal cord to muscles, glands and other effector organs. Upon entering or exiting the spinal cord, the roots are subdivided into rootlets.
info.item: /Sections/Thin, Spinal Cord to Cerebrum/5 Cervical cord, lower
